refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The drouter.conf5 file (located at "/etc/drouter/drouter.conf") is the main configuration file for the DRouter system.

refsect1.title: File Format
refsect1.para: The file format consists of sections, each of which contain configuration information in the form of keyword/value pairs. Each section begins with the name of the section in [] brackets, followed by zero or more keyword/value pairs, with the keyword and value seperated by an '=' sign. Lines starting with ; (semi-colon) are ignored, as are blank lines.

refsect2.title: The [Drouterd] Section
refsect2.para: The [Drouter] section configures operation of the drouterd8 service daemon. It contains the following parameters:

listitem.para: Where email-addr is the e-mail address to which drouterd8 will send server alerts. If not specified, then drouterd8 will not generate e-mailed server alerts.
See also the FromAddress= directive below.
Where level is the audio level (in tenths of a dBFS) above which to treat an audio port as being in a 'clipping' state.
Where msecs is the period of time for which an audio port must be above the clip threshold before a clip alarm will be generated.
Set the limit on the number of simultaneously open file descriptors to num. Default value is 1024.

Where email-addr is the e-mail address which drouterd8 will use as the originating address when sending server alert messages. If not specified, then drouterd8 will not generate e-mailed server alerts.
See also the AlertAddress= directive above.

Where prio is an integer indicating the priority to use when logging internal IPC messages between the DRouter core and protocol modules. Mostly useful for debugging purposes. Default value is 7 ("Debug").

The following values for prio are recognized:
0 - Emergency (system is unusable)
1 - Alert (action must be taken immediately)
2 - Critical (critical conditions)
3 - Error (error conditions)
4 - Warning (warning conditions)
5 - Notice (normal but significant condition)
6 - Info (informational)
7 - Debug (debug-level messages)
-1 - Disable (disable logging)
Where passwd is the password that drouterd8 will use when attempting to log in to the LWRP service on each node. This option is seldom required.

Where mb is an integer that is passed to MySQL/MariaDB to set the max_heap_data_size configuration variable. This value determines the maximum amount of memory (in bytes) that the DB back end will allocate per table. Default value is 33,554,321 (32 MB).

Where dev-name is the device name of a class of device (taken from the "VER" LWRP command) for which audio alarms should not be configured. This is to deal with certain devices --e.g. Telos Vx systems -- that throw spurious protocol errors when an LWRP client attempts to configure audio alarms.
Where prio is an integer indicating the priority to use when logging node device connects and disconnects. Default value is 5 ("Notice").
See the IpcLogPriority entry (above) for the list of values recognized for prio.

Where hours is the interval of time (in hours) to retains event records in the event log, with older records being periodically purged. Setting this parameter to 0 will completely disable automatic record purging (not recommended).
Where level is the audio level (in tenths of a dBFS) below which to treat an audio port as being in a 'silence' state.
Where msecs is the period of time for which an audio port must be below the silence threshold before a silence alarm will be generated.

refsect2.title: The [Nodes] Section
refsect2.para: The [Nodes] section allows for LWRP statements to be sent directly to one or more specific Livewire nodes during startup initialization by drouterd8. It contains the following parameters:

listitem.para: Where ipv4-addr is the IPv4 address of a node in dotted-quad notation and num is an integer, starting with 1 and incremented for each node referenced in the [Nodes] section.
Where lwrp is a comma-separated list of LWRP statements to be sent to the node specified by the corresponding HostAddressnum directive.

refsect3.title: Example
refsect3.programlisting:
[Nodes] HostAddress1=10.1.1.20 StartupLwrp1=CFG GPO 1 SRCA:"2000" FUNC:"FOLLOW"
HostAddress2=10.1.1.40 StartupLwrp2=CFG GPO 1 SRCA:"4000" FUNC:"FOLLOW",GPO 1 lhhhh
refsect3.para: The above example would cause the following LWRP statement to be sent to the node at 10.1.1.20:
and the following statements to the node at 10.1.1.40:
refsect3.programlisting: CFG GPO 1 SRCA:"4000" FUNC:"FOLLOW" GPO 1 lhhhh

refsect2.title: The [Matrixnum] Sections
refsect2.para: Zero or more [Matrixnum] sections can be added, with num starting with 1 and incremented for each additional section. Each such section corresponds to a set of one or more switcher device(s), to be controlled as a constellation of devices.

listitem.para: Where type-code is one of the following strings:
Broadcast Tools Universal 4.1 MLR>>Web Switcher

Required parameters:
HostAddress=ipv4-addr
HostPort=port-num
Grass Valley Series 7000 Control Protocol

Required parameters:
HostAddress=ipv4-addr
HostPort=port-num
Livewire AoIP, via Livewire Routing Protocol
Required parameters: none.
The IPv4 address of the switcher, in dotted-quad notation.
The port number to connect to on the switcher, in the range 1 through 65535 inclusive.

refsect2.title: The [Tether] Section
refsect2.para: The [Tether] section configures operation of a pair of Drouter instances operating in an auto-failover configuration. It contains the following parameters:

listitem.para: The "master switch" that turns the tethered redundant hosts feature on or off. If No (the default), the tethering features are completely deactivated, and none of the other parameters in this section have any effect.

The IPv4 address, in dotted quad format, to be used as the primary service address for the cluster. This addresses should be on the same subnet as that specified in the SystemAAddress= and SystemBAddress= parameters (see below).
This address will be automatically assigned to whichever cluster instance is active.
The name of each of the hosts constituting the Drouter cluster.

The dedicated IPv4 address, in dotted-quad format, for each of the hosts constituting the Drouter cluster. These addresses should be on the same subnet as that specified in the SharedIpAddress= parameter (see above).
The name of the serial device --e.g. /dev/ttyS0 -- to be used for the heartbeat connection to the opposite member of the cluster.
The IPv4 address, in dotted-quad notation, of the GPIO node(s) to send state changes to indicate the respective instance's active state. These state changes are sent by means of LWRP.
The slot number on the GPIO node(s) indicated in the SystemAIpAddress or SystemBIpAddress to which to send state changes to indicate the respective instance's active state.
The type of GPIO to use on the GPIO node(s) indicated in the SystemAIpAddress or SystemBIpAddress to which to send state changes to indicate the respective instance's active state.
The code string to apply on the GPIO node(s) indicated in the SystemAIpAddress or SystemBIpAddress to which to send state changes to indicate the respective instance's active state.
